page.title: 14SCHOLE BROOK FARM, TONG
page.content: I own 224 acres of land in Tong and rent 100. Since the new EEC regulations in l984 I have changed from dairy farming to rearing beef cattle and sheep. Apart from 52 acres of rough grazing all the land is good pasture land and I estimate that I shall produce 200 tons of silage and l2000 bales of hay this year. I buy barley straw for eating and bedding. In addition I have 40,000 laying hens in batteries and run a registered egg packing station. I buy the corn for the hens. I kept two Friesian cows which provide milk for both my family and my brother's; we give the surplus milk to the few pigs we keep. The majority of the cattle go to Huddersfield market but the underweight ones are sold at York to cereal farmers for fattening up. I have six men and two part time women.
